name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!
Outcome - End of batch group Recitals

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Tiny Detectives at Atta Galatta - Treasure Hunt
description:
Welcome to the Treasure of Treasure Hunts!
If you’re on the lookout for a racy, entertaining hour filled with cryptic clues, secret messages, puzzles, riddles, anagrams, and more, Tiny Detectives at Atta Galatta is just the adventure for you!
Specially crafted for curious minds aged 6 to 12 years, this indoor treasure hunt promises giggles, gasps, and “Aha!” moments galore. Kids will put their thinking caps on, race from clue to clue, and work together to crack codes and uncover hidden surprises.
And what’s a good hunt without a feast at the end? We’ll wind up the evening with a sumptuous snack party to fuel all that brainwork and celebrate a galatta-filled time!

name: Gond Art Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Indian Gond Art - A Tribal Folk Art practiced by one of the largest tribes in India called Gondi, from Madhya Pradesh. The history of the Gond people dates nearly 1400 years from the Dravidian origin and this community has a unique painting style that makes extensive use of dots, fine lines, dashes and other geometric shapes.
The imagery of these paintings are borderless, bold and loud.
Blended with mystery, humour, these art pieces depict a modern psyche.
A great form of art to start with your basic art skill, interesting and electrified art that gets you fascinated about Indian Art Forms!!
You need not have any prior experience in drawing or painting in order to attend this course.
Note: All Materials will be provided by the host.
What will you take home?
Knowledge of Indian Art Culture
Learn an ancient art form
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
This workshop includes all materials, if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board.
Kindly be on time, entry of the participants will not be allowed late beyond 15 minutes.
No refunds on cancellations.

name: Curious Minds, Conscious Choices: The Power of Asking Why - Meetup
description:
How does the content you consume shape your thoughts, decisions, and behavior?
Are you curious about the root causes of human behavior?
Do you want the freedom to challenge every statement and engage in an open discussion?
Looking for unbiased answers to your toughest questions?
Join us for an interactive Q&A-based session that encourages critical thinking and questioning!
This session is part of #MyConsumptionMyResponsibility, an initiative by Simon Jakkam aimed at raising awareness about how information, media, and content consumption profoundly impact our thoughts, behaviors, and overall well-being—especially among young minds.
What Makes This Session Unique?
✅ 100% Q&A-based: No lectures—only real discussions! I’ll answer questions directly from the audience.
✅ Challenge My Answers: You can counter-question every statement I make until you're completely satisfied with the response.
✅ Root-Cause Analysis: My responses will go beyond surface-level explanations and focus on why things happen the way they do.
Why Is This Important?
With digital consumption at an all-time high, even young children are exposed to unfiltered content that shapes their thinking and behavior—often without them realizing it. They cannot filter what’s right or wrong. This makes mindful consumption a necessity, not a choice. Understanding its impact is the need of the hour as it influences every aspect of life.
Come, challenge, question, and discover how mindful consumption can transform your life!

name: The Middle of Everything - Book Launch
description:
The Middle of Everything is a delightful collection of life’s essence and encapsulates 56 short humorous and inspirational pieces.
Vivek Atray, the Author is also Motivational Speaker and an ex-IAS officer. Hiis 5th book, ‘The Middle of Everything’ contains titles like "A Yawning Divide", "Bad Hair Days" and "He held her Hand".  Fern Tree is the publisher of the book.
The Middle of Everything by Vivek Atray is a book that exemplifies all that is cheerful and peppy in life. The pages of this book will calm your mind and warm your heart. The Middle of Everything is a motley mélange of middles (short humorous or inspirational pieces) published on the editorial pages of leading newspapers.
Join us for the launch, only at Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, on 3rd May at 3 PM!

name: Echoes of Spring - Painting Workshop
description: Join us for a fun multimedia floral painting workshop! We’ll create a dreamy scene with a soft, blurred background and vibrant wildflowers up close. Learn to add depth and texture using simple techniques. All materials will be provided!

name: Sprinting Through Ancient India! - Interactive Session and DIY Comic Workshop
description:
How do we know what we know about ancient India? Join this interactive session with stories, discoveries—and make your own history-inspired comic!
Saisudha Acharya makes Indian history come alive with wild stories, forgotten facts, and humour. A published author, educator, and compulsive reader, she believes the best way to understand the present is by asking better questions about the past.

name: (K)Not Your Saree - Fashion Healing and Rephilosophy Session
description:
Want to have a fearless and intutive moment with your unstitched, unused or hoarded textile - sari, stole, dupatta, or dhoti?
Register for (K)NOT YOUR SAREE #fashionhealing #rephilosophy session by Fashion Editor-Educator, Yoga-Pranayama Teacher, and Founder of Spiritual Fashion Platform www.revastra.com / @re_vastra
Date: 3rd May 2025
Day: Saturday
Time: 530 pm to 730 pm
Fee: INR 499
Venue: Atta Galattta, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
1. We will explore a modern version of the ancient kashta or kacchakattu drape.
2. We will discuss rituals and practices of handwoven textiles and more.
3. We will exchange and learn style / identity tips and techniques in an immersive sharing circle.
4. We will read out soulful, saree stories that matter with people who matter.
FACILITATOR
The session is conducted by Bhawana Pingali, former Fashion Features Editor of FEMINA (Worldwide Media Ltd.—Times of India / BBC Magazines). She is a mother of a teen, has been an editor-educator for the last 19+ years, and is currently authoring a book with PENGUIN. Her articles have appeared in The Hindu, Hindustan Times-Mint Lounge, Time Out, Lonely Planet, Travel + Leisure, Maxim, Orissa Post, Signature-Oman, among others. She has taught at NIFT, Pearl Academy, Symbiosis Institute of Design, CEPT-Ahmedabad, IIM-A, British Council (TEFL-certified trainer), GD Goenka and Ansal Universities. Her heart now lies in teaching yoga, and reviving saris and rituals through fashion research lab REVASTRA.

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Friendships - Sharing Session
description:
Ah, friends. And friendships! We remember our childhood friends with glee. We can recount endless stories about how we all stole mangoes and climbed unruly trees. But adult friendships? Somewhere, we quiet down.
What is so hard about making friends in adulthood? Is it the intimacy of having other responsibilities? Yet, friendships are known to be one of the greatest determinants of happiness in life. Somehow, we let that flail.
This conversational space is to rekindle friendships. To think of the ones who nourish us. To talk about what prevents us from forming deep, intimate relationships with those who aren’t our primary partners. Let’s talk.
Share the best memories of our childhood and adulthood. And let’s find new friends, shall we? While we cherish the existing ones?
What is MyStories?
MyStories are community gatherings where we sit down and gently talk about life. These are informal gatherings. Some will be facilitated by a mental health professional. Some not. But the objective is one: Can we speak? Can we have a conversation with each other? Can strangers meet and part as friends?
Meet the host
This session is hosted by our co-founder and writer, Smitha Murthy. Smitha is the author of Worlds Apart, a memoir, and runs MyndStories with her old friend and foe, Swati Nair. One day, she dreams of a world where we build bridges through kindness and where mental health has no stigma.
What should you bring?
An item you would like to speak about that holds special meaning for you. It can be anything that you hold close. Reminisce, recollect, retell. We want to hear you speak about the memory closest to your heart.
 
What to expect from this session
A typical MyStories event has a theme around which we open up and share our stories. For this event, ‘Memories’ is our theme. 
What this session is not

A dating session
A networking meet-up
Startup something or the other

This is a listen-and-learn-and-connect session. 
The session does not include food and drinks. Any food or drinks can be bought from the cafe at the venue and will be paid for individually.

name: Shaam-e-Sukhan - Ghazal and Sufi Performance
description:
An enchanting evening of romantic ghazal & divine sufi melodies awaits you let the soulful voice of Koyel Mukherjee vocalist, (Zee Saregamapa fame), the mesmerising tabla by Partha Chatterjee and magical keys of Rishabh Chauhan takes you on the journey of love, divineness and tranquillity.
The band name is Ruh_voyage previously called as Ruhaniyat_sufi.

name: Liberate Through Lavani - Lecture
description:
Join us for an insightful session that offers a glimpse into the lives of traditional Lavani artists from matriarchal communities. Through an engaging audio-visual presentation, we'll explore the significance of Lavani in modern times, highlighting its themes of love and liberation.
Bhushan has been engaging with Lavani artists since 2002, which led him to write his award-winning book ‘Sangeet Bari’ in 2014. Based on this book, he created the much-acclaimed show ‘Sangeet Bari’ ‘Lavani Ke Rang’, ‘Love & Lavani’, and ‘Kahin Pyar Ho Na Jaaen’. He has written Lavani and other songs for music videos produced by ‘Agents of Ishq’. Bhushan also writes fiction that primarily deals with sexuality and crime. His stories on the ‘Storytel’ app are widely popular, as are his periodic features in ‘Loksatta’ and ‘Mint Lounge' where he chronicles his relationship with unique cuisines. Bhushan has recently translated Shahu Patole’s Marathi book ‘Dalit Kitchens of Marathwada’ into English.   (You can rephrase this bio for the workshop - where it will start with my work about eroticas)
B Spot Productions creates performances that enable communities to share their stories, facilitate the audience to explore sensory pleasures and initiate conversations on taboo topics. They also conduct Lavani workshops, writing workshops, food trails and culture trails. The group is founded by Mumbai based writer Bhushan Korgaonkar with a team of multi-disciplinary collaborators including Geetanjali Kulkarni, Kunal Vijayakar, Anita Date, Reshma Shetty, Wasimbarry Maner and others who create these stories of love & desire, crime & thrill, humour & hope.

name: The Art of Erotica – Writing with Sensuality and Style - Writing Workshop
description:
Sex is an inevitable part of our lives. Most of us indulge in either doing it, dreaming it, dreading it or otherwise thinking about it at some point in time. Years of social conditioning makes us consider it as ‘undesirable’, ‘immoral’ and ‘dirty’ but in fact, it is ‘desirable’, ‘natural’ and ‘healthy’.
In this workshop, you can learn to navigate the fine line between titillating and tacky, and discover how to craft compelling erotic content. Explore various aspects of sexuality and sensuality. Discover your niche and develop your skills in writing erotic content that resonates with your audience. Gain relevant information and techniques to enhance your writing, and take away valuable tips to apply to your own work.

name: Swipe Right on Your Career - LinkedIn Workshop
description:
The only LinkedIn workshop you'll ever need.
 
What's in it for you?
- Content writing 101
- Ways to be on TOP of MIND
- Designing your digi-visiting card
- Tricks to attract the eyes of recruiters
- Networking strategy with 10x better results
and all these are not the best part. The fun part is:
🟢 Scroll-stopper challenges await
🟣 Bold badges, secret missions
🟠 Applauses you didn’t ask for
🟡 You’ll post without posting
🔵 Real talk. Unreal energy.
Save the date: 10 May, 2025

name: Intro to Nature Journaling – Discover, Observe, Create - A Hands-On Workshop
description:
Join us for an immersive Nature Journaling Workshop designed for parents and kids to explore the wonders of nature together. This session will introduce families to the importance of nature journaling, how it nurtures curiosity, creativity, and mindfulness, and provide practical tips on how to get started.
What to Expect?
Why Nature Journaling? – A short interactive talk for parents on its benefits and how to encourage kids to observe and document nature.
Hands-On Journaling – Guided exercises to help kids and parents create their first nature journal entry.
This workshop is designed to spark curiosity, deepen connections with nature, and create lasting memories between parents and children.
Date & Time: 10th May, Saturday @ 4-6pm
Location: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Who can join? Parents and kids (ideal for ages 6-10 yr old)
Limited Slots Available!
Please note you need to bring stationary, colours & lots of excitement.
Come observe, journal, and celebrate nature with us!

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember  - Sawubona: We See You.

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!

description:
Immerse yourself on a journey of self-discovery through journaling and art!
 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Pricing is Rs 9000 per person for a 5-day session.
Material is provided
Batch size 5 people only
For more details, please call at 8660217440 or 9902059257

name: Nature Workshop - Workshop
description:
Tap into your creativity with this nature workshop, learn how to green your spaces, care for indoor plants, plant assortments and make your own indoor planter.
By appointment only, a session can be scheduled by calling 8660217440 or 9902059257, and between the following dates and times: 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Ticket Price: INR 1500 per person, per day
Single day workshop
Batch size 5 people only
Material is provided

name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!
